page.title: 11RAVENSCRAIG CASTLE
page.content: Ravenscraig Castle was started in 1460 and finished in 1464. It was built by James II as a coastal defence against the English. It was the first castle to be built for defence by artillery. The most famous cannon was Mons Meg, now at Edinburgh Castle. The tower of Ravenscriag Castle was the residence of Queen Mary of Gueldres. In it were three rooms, her living room, her bed room and a rest room. The water for the castle came from a forty feet deep well. The kitchens were at the back of the castle. The walls of the castle were 14 feet thick. After Queen Mary's death James did a swap. He exchanged the castle for the Orkney islands which were owned by the Sinclair family. The castle has been taken over by the Department of the Environment.
